Study at Ulster University

At Ulster University, our students are at the heart of everything that we do. The experience we offer is designed to develop your skills and confidence, raise your ambitions and help you succeed in your future career.

Study options

Whatever your ambition, at Ulster University we can offer a way of learning that works with your life. Whether you are considering undergraduate or postgraduate study, you will join a vibrant student community where there are new friendships to be made, ideas to be shared and opportunities to be explored.

Undergraduate

Fulfil your potential and shape your future with an undergraduate degree from Ulster University.

Postgraduate

Gain the knowledge, skills and confidence to enhance your career with a postgraduate course at Ulster University.

Postgraduate Research

We have numerous research opportunities open to applicants from home and overseas.

Short courses and CPD

We provide high-quality short courses for everyone. Whether you want to improve your job prospects, learn new skills, get a qualification or develop workplace training, we can help.

Part-time

Take control of your learning journey and study at a pace that suits you with a flexible part-time course at Ulster University.

eLearning

Join over 4,000 students who have graduated from Ulster University with an online degree or short course qualification - eLearning courses offer flexibility enabling you to study at your own pace, any place and any time.






Life and learning at Ulster

From research-led teaching to first class resources and facilities, all within a supportive learning environment, the student experience we offer at Ulster is designed to help you succeed.

  • Accommodation
  • Alumni and supporters
  • Campuses
  • Clubs and societies
  • Employability and careers
  • Library services
  • Sport
  • Students' Union
  • Student support

 

Thanks to the modern laboratory I can perform amazing research that will broaden my knowledge and give me an amazing experience for the future. Thanks to these facilities it is easier for me to acquire knowledge and understand many phenomena.

Paula Smyczek Student - Poland
FireSERT (Safety, Engineering, Research & Technology Centre)



 

The International Department is one of the best I have ever seen. The office offers and provides me with support whenever I need it. They supported me from arrival, settling, registering with medical practice, providing information about accommodation, supermarkets, places to see. I will definitely recommend this university to others!

Purna Prasad Student - India
MSc Management student




Ulster University will provide you with lots of opportunities… whether that’s a placement year, Erasmus grant or the chance to be a course representative. These can be life-changing and set you up to excel and get that graduate job.

Christopher McCausland Student
Electronic Engineering




Ulster in three words… Challenging, rewarding, illuminating

Cathal McDaid Student
English




(My postgraduate course) has enabled me to make a career change at the age of 55! I am already reaping the benefits of having studied with Ulster University, having received a couple of temporary job offers abroad and I am confident that further opportunities will arise in the future.

Susan Turner
Teaching of English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL)




It is never too late to return to university. I found it daunting at first, but at Ulster University there are plenty of resources and help for mature students. It is tough but rewarding, so go for it.

Pauric McCaughey Student
Fire Safety Engineering
